result.execSummary:
The defendant Chris D Hiemstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$2,500.00 cash bond to be applied.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed by a licensed physician.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Must apply to the Barron County Drug Court Program.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants one day credit if revoked.
Must complete 200 hours of community service for every year on probation for a total of 600 hours.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: to any sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Financial obligations are reduced to judgment.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 01/06/2016 AMENDED FROM CONCURRENT WITH ANY SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED TO CONSECUTIVE TO ANY SENTENCE CURRENTLY BEING SERVED.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.
